feed.title: Ankit Kanojiya
feed.subtitle: A minimal, responsive, and powerful Jekyll theme for presenting professional writing.

entry.title: Hack The Box - Investigation
entry.summary:
In this machine, I had to exploit a known vulnerability in exiftool, find a password in some logs, and finally reverse a program to find how to exploit it.
Room: Investigation Difficulty: Medium URL: https://app.hackthebox.com/machines/Investigation Author: Derezzed
Enumeration
I began the box by running Rustscan to look for open ports.
$ rustscan -a target -- -A | tee rust.txt .-...

entry.title: Hack The Box - Encoding
entry.summary:
This was a really fun box. I had to exploit two LFI vulnerabilities and PHP filters to get a foothold. Then exploit git configuration and systemd to escalate my privileges.
Room: Encoding Difficulty: Medium URL: https://app.hackthebox.com/machines/Encoding Author: kavigihan
Enumeration
I started by scanning for open ports.
$ rustscan -a target -- -A | tee rust.txt .----. .-. .-. ....

entry.title: Hack The Box - BroScience
entry.summary:
In this box, I had to exploit an LFI, a vulnerable token generation, and a serialization vulnerability to get to a shell. Then I had to crack a hashed password, and finally, get code execution in a script running as root.
Room: BroScience Difficulty: Medium URL: https://app.hackthebox.com/machines/BroScience Author: bmdyy
Enumeration
I began the box by scanning for open ports.
$ r...

entry.title: Hack The Box - Mentor
entry.summary:
This machine took me a long time to own because I failed at basic enumeration. Most of the work to do this box was in finding the passwords laying around.
Room: Mentor Difficulty: Medium URL: https://app.hackthebox.com/machines/Mentor Author: kavigihan
Enumeration
I began by launching Rustscan to find open ports.
$ rustscan -a target -- -A | tee rust.txt .----. .-. .-. .----..---....

entry.title: Hack The Box Walkthrough - Awkward
entry.summary:
This was a difficult box for me. I had to exploit a web application to get Remote Code Execution, find the user’s password in an notes file, then exploit the same application a second time to get root.
Room: Awkward Difficulty: Medium URL: https://app.hackthebox.com/machines/Awkward Author: coopertim13
Enumeration
I started by enumerating open ports with rustscan.
$ rustscan -a ta...
